• Execute production operations according to defined procedures and ensure the integrity and quality of our products Ability to operate and maintain laboratory to clean room standards required in the tracking of production data, test data and inventory Assembly of 10x consumables and finished goods both manually and using semi-automated packaging equipment Ability to set up and operate packaging and escalate issues to supervisor’s or MSE’s attention High school education / Associate Degree or above Strong team player and detail oriented Good communication skills Ability to read and understand SOPs and equipment user manual Ability to enter data into electronic tracking systems like Excel Ability to multi-task and prioritize work load to meet strict deadlines under supervision Good documentation skills and ability to write procedures and reports Desire to be part of a rapidly evolving organization and taking products and processes to the next level Ability to lift up to 15 pounds and potentially stand or sit for up to 3 hour increments Experience in automation and packaging of Life Science products, Food Packaging products or related field preferred Relevant experience in a production environment working with standard production control tools – ERP, inventory control, and work orders Experience training employees on production processes defined in production batch records and work instructions Experience writing and revising work instructions and production batch records Experienced in communicating and collaborating with production departments Document Control
